title: Kayle a possible illaoi counter?
body:
So ive only played the matchup maybe 5 times now and i havnt played illaoi to get a feel of her kit yet but ive won every match up.

I mean like roflstomped.

5/1 in lane kind of win.

Mostly because ive found it easy to dodge her skill shots with w and even if i get vessled its really not that difficult to deal with.

Granted im only bronze so it could just be my elo sucking at illaoi but who knows might be a pretty viable counter pick.

Edit: I should mention i run a full page of mpen runes with armor yellow, and the thunderlord keystone which is letting me just destroy her hp bar faster than she destroys mine, and my ult counters hers obviously.

replies.body: using {{champion:85}} was pretty easy against Illaoi

care to elaborate on that?

id just do the research myself by playing heaps of illaoi games till i understand her kit (like i did kindred and kalista and stuff) but i just dont like the look of her playstyle tbh.

But shes a pretty strong laner atm so would be nice to put together a bunch of counter picks.

Honestly I've found it's easy either way as long as you play right, like i was playing Vi top and every time she landed her spirit grab i just walked back to turret and then dodged each of the three tentacles attacks then killed them, because they only attack once by themselves when summoned (unless you wait longer to find out XD) but then it's only a matter of being sure to not let her utilize those tentacles, and when she ults just get walk away from her (save your dashes/escapes if you can) and wait out the duration of her ult because the tentacles she summons that way are temporary, then go back in if you know you have the damage, mana, cool-downs, etc.

She's only a danger is she's got them tentacles and can actually use them, also depending on her build, because she is a juggernaut so you should invest in a Lord Dominiks Regard if you're building Attack damage.

just a few tips for countering her :) learned these things by playing her and playing against her :P

Yeah i do the same thing with the vessel.

The ult though, i tend to just facetank and i stay constantly moving around her so i can dodge the tentacles and such.

I think of her as a sion with multiple q's

Unfortunately that's not as much of a reliable tactic, sure if you think you can sustain the damage from her and return enough to kill her then by all means but if it's early game and she's set and ready you really shouldn't risk it, the Cds on her W alone allow her to utilize a shit-ton of damage in short intervals with lots of sustainability at her call.

I've played as her many times and I usually come out on top because I know her weaknesses and make sure I remember that for her opportunity is what makes her deadlier than ever, so just make sure you don't give her the opportunity to destroy you, but if you can't help it then at least be careful and ready when you do risk it.

I realize this took me 6 months to reply lol but that's just because I never checked to see if I had a notification XD

haha all good, yeah in those 6 months ive lost maybe 1 or 2 illaoi matchups regardless of the champion i play, so im going to assume that its just my elo sucking ass.

Combined with the vessel changes (i can just face tank the vessel and wait out the incredibly short timer now, doesnt feel dangerous at all anymore)

I haven't even been able to play in at least the last three months so I've missed a lot of changes, but I never really felt like she was all too powerful, like you could easily counter her if you know how to and you can outplay her just as so it's just a matter of skill and knowledge I suppose, a lot of experience with and against the champion helps! Haha

But in saying that if you know how to play her properly, whether they know how to counter you or not, if you can play her properly you would destroy your enemies with the right opportunities you can do almost anything really, buy that's true of any champ I just think with Illaoi it's extra crucial, so ganking can secure you kills either because they ganked or you had help (or for those skilled enough who were the jungler).
Most of the time that's when I get my most opportunistic kills because my opponents underestimated me and tried for a 2 v 1 and maybe tower dived thinking that they had the drop on me, even though I usually wait for that to actually have something interesting happen up top instead of just happily farming away and harrassing with my tentacles XD
nah its fervor kayle with guinsoo whats you on about

nah willis she can proc thunderlords in one auto if you q first and have e on (if e isnt always on wtf you playing kayle for)

Get a ludens and a bitch ton of ap and you can one shot a %%%%%%.
so 1 shot and then die, or 1v5 and come out unscathed and with a penta? pretty sure the latter is better

1 shot adc, then 2 shot tank, then pop ult because that assasin is getting cocky, one shot him too.

Oh your low? good thing you have heaps of AP and can heal yourself.

Granted ive been playing her AD Crit today, so much better with thunderlords and 100% crit chance.
thats not what you were saying, you were saying go full ap so they die after a aa, but ou would have super low aa speed and q would be on a 4.5 sec cd (max cdr), you then proceed to die useless
Whenever someone picks {{champion:420}} i laugh and instalock {{champion:75}} She can't do anything vs him free stacks for him every tentacle.

Counter new champions?
